                      <ns1:status>
                        <ns1:code>4223</ns1:code>
                        <ns1:msg>Buddy Relationship does not exist</ns1:msg>
                      </ns1:status>
                    </ns1:contact-delete-response>
  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/ab/contact:
    post:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Post Create Address book Contact 54
      description: |
        This method is used for adding a contact
        
        NOTIFICATIONS GENERATED
        | NOTIFICATION          | DESCRIPTION                                                          |
        |-----------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
        | Address Book Modified | Triggered if the client is configured to generate this notification. |
      requestBody:
        description: |
          INPUT ELEMENTS AND ATTRIBUTES
          The input should have the following ELEMENTS or ATTRIBUTES
          | ELEMENTS          | ATTRIBUTES  | DESCRIPTION                                                                                | REQUIRED | LENGTH           |
          |-------------------|-------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------|------------------|
          | contact           | id          | Id of Contact                                                                              | OPTIONAL | RAW( 16 )        |
          | contact           | tempid      | Tempid of Contact                                                                          | OPTIONAL |                  |
          | contact           | version     | Version of contact                                                                         | OPTIONAL | NUMBER( 6)       |
          | firstname         |             | First Name of the contact                                                                  | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | lastname          |             | Last Name of the contact                                                                   | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | middlename        |             | Middle Name of the contact                                                                 | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | nameprefix        |             | NamePrefix of contact                                                                      | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | namesuffix        |             | NameSuffix of contact                                                                      | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | nickname          |             | Nickname of contact                                                                        | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | birthday          |             | Birthdate of contact                                                                       | NO       | Date             |
          | source            |             | The source from where the contact originated.                                              | NO       | VARCHAR2(255)    |
          | deletionsource    |             | Indicates the deletion source.                                                             | NO       | VARCHAR2(255)    |
          | endpointassoc     | type        | EndpointType of contact                                                                    | RO       | VARCHAR2(255)    |
          | endpointassoc     | id          | EndpoinId of contact                                                                       | RO       | VARCHAR2(1024)   |
          | endpointassoc     | name        | Endpoint name of contact                                                                   | NO       | VARCHAR2(1024)   |
          | endpointassoc     | state       | Contact state to the endpoint The values might be promoted, demoted, propmote_pending etc. | NO       | VARCHAR2(1024)   |
          | buddyassoc        | buddyuserid | Buddy UserId of contact                                                                    | RO       | NUMBER(20)       |
          | shareassoc        | id          | ShareId associated with contact                                                            | RO       | RAW(16)          |
          | shareassoc        | name        | ShareName associated with contact                                                          | RO       | VARCHAR2(1024)   |
          | prefmodeofcontact | type        | The type of preferred mode of communication for the contact                                | NO       | VARCHAR2( 64 )   |
          | prefmodeofcontact | value       | The preferred mode of communication for the contact                                        | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | conflicttype      |             | Conflict Type of contact                                                                   | RO       | CHAR(1)          |
          | incaseofemergency |             | Specifies contact as ICE or not                                                            | NO       | CHAR(1)          |
          | favorite          |             | Specifies contact as favourite                                                             | NO       | CHAR(1)          |
          | photo             | ContentType | Photo of contact                                                                           | NO       | VARCHAR2(333)    |
          | photoreference    |             | Photo reference or the Picture Id                                                          | RO       | VARCHAR2(333)    |
          | anniversary       |             | Marriage anniversary date                                                                  | NO       | Date             |
          | spouse            |             | Spouse of contact                                                                          | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | children          |             | Children Names of contact                                                                  | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | note              |             | Note for the contact                                                                       | NO       | CLOB             |
          | orgname           |             | Company Name of contact                                                                    | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | orgunit           |             | Company Department of contact                                                              | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | jobtitle          |             | Job titile of contact                                                                      | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | profession        |             | Profession of contact                                                                      | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | assistant         |             | Assistant Name of contact                                                                  | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | gender            |             | Gender of the contact                                                                      | NO       | CHAR(1)          |
          | relationship      |             | Relationship of the contact with the person                                                | NO       | VARCHAR2(255)    |
          | maritalstatus     |             | Marital status of the contact                                                              | NO       | VARCHAR2(255)    |
          | timezone          |             | Timezone of the contact                                                                    | NO       | NUMBER(4)        |
          | created           |             | Created date of contact                                                                    | NO       | Date             |
          | modified          |             | Modified date of contact                                                                   | NO       | Date             |
          | tel               | type        | Telephone type of contact                                                                  | YES      | NUMBER( 4 )      |
          | tel               | indx        | Telephone indx of contact                                                                  | NO       |                  |
          | number            |             | Telephone Number of contact                                                                | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | carrier           |             | Telephone Carrier of contact                                                               | NO       | NUMBER(4)        |
          | preference        |             | Telephone Preference of contact                                                            | NO       | NUMBER(2)        |
          | email             | type        | Email Type of contact                                                                      | YES      | NUMBER( 4 )      |
          | email             | indx        | Email Indx of contact                                                                      | NO       |                  |
          | address           |             | Email Address of contact                                                                   | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | preference        |             | Email Preference of contact                                                                | NO       | NUMBER(2)        |
          | im                | type        | IM type of contact                                                                         | YES      | NUMBER( 4 )      |
          | address           |             | IM address of contact                                                                      | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | preference        |             | IM preference of contact                                                                   | NO       | NUMBER(2)        |
          | address           | type        | Address type of the contact                                                                | YES      | NUMBER( 4 )      |
          | address           | indx        | Address indx of the contact                                                                | NO       |                  |
          | pobox             |             | Post box number of the address                                                             | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | street            |             | Street Number of the address                                                               | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | apartment         |             | Apartment Number of the address                                                            | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | city              |             | City of the address                                                                        | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | state             |             | State of the address                                                                       | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | zipcode           |             | Zipcode of the address                                                                     | NO       | VARCHAR2( 255 )  |
          | country           |             | Country of the address                                                                     | NO       | VARCHAR2( 508 )  |
          | preference        |             | Preference of the address                                                                  | NO       | NUMBER(2)        |
          | webpage           | type        | Webpage Type of contact                                                                    | YES      | NUMBER( 4 )      |
          | webpage           | indx        | Webpage Indx of contact                                                                    | NO       |                  |
          | url               |             | Webpage Url of contact                                                                     | NO       | VARCHAR2( 1000 ) |
          | preference        |             | Preference of the webpage                                                                  | NO       | VARCHAR2( 1000 ) |
          | groups            |             | Groups Type of contact                                                                     | YES      |                  |
          | groups            | group       | Group added to contact                                                                     | NO       |                  |
          | group             | id          | Group Id                                                                                   | YES      | RAW( 16 )        |
          | group             | name        | Name of the group                                                                          | YES      | VARCHAR2(50)     |
          | group             | version     | Version of the group                                                                       | YES      | NUMBER(6)        |
          | group             | type        | Group Type                                                                                 | YES      | char(1)          |
          | group             | itemGuid    | Group item guid                                                                            | NO       | RAW( 16 )        |
          | extfield          | name        | Name of the extensible field                                                               | YES      | VARCHAR2(256)    |
          | extfield          | value       | Value of the extensible field                                                              | YES      | VARCHAR2(256)    |
          | dedupe            |             | Dedupe status of the contact can be set to pending or completed                            | OPTIONAL | VARCHAR2( 2 )    |

          application/xml:
            schema:
              type: object

              example: >-
                <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

                            <ns1:msg>Addressbook locked as the dedupe is in progress</ns1:msg>
                            <ns1:contact/>
                        </ns1:status>
                      </ns1:contact-add-response>
        '500':
          description: Successful response
          content:

              schema:
                type: object

                  name: Post Create Address book Contact response

          |     shareassoc           |     name            |     ShareName   associated with contact                                     |     RO          |     VARCHAR2(1024)        |

    put:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Put Create Address book Contacts 55 pending
      description: |
        This method is used for modifying the contacts.The following operations are supported
        | OPERATION  | DESCRIPTION                    |
        |------------|--------------------------------|
        | DELETE     | Deletes contacts               |
        | PERMDELETE | Permanent Deletion of contacts |
        | MODIFY     | Modify contacts                |
        | PROMOTE    | Promote contacts               |
        | DEMOTE     | Demote contacts                |
      requestBody:
        description: |
          INPUT ELEMENTS AND ATTRIBUTES
          
          The input should have the following ELEMENTS or ATTRIBUTES specific to the operations performed
          | ELEMENTS          | ATTRIBUTES  | DESCRIPTION                                                                                | REQUIRED               |
          |-------------------|-------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------|
          | modify            | replace     | boolean value specifies the operation is modify or replace                                 | YES. Default is modify |
          | contact           | id          | Id of Contact                                                                              | YES                    |
          | contact           | tempid      | Tempid of Contact                                                                          | NOT NEEDED             |
          | contact           | version     | Version of contact                                                                         | YES                    |
          | firstname         |             | First Name of the contact                                                                  | NO                     |
          | lastname          |             | Last Name of the contact                                                                   | NO                     |
          | middlename        |             | Middle Name of the contact                                                                 | NO                     |
          | nameprefix        |             | NamePrefix of contact                                                                      | NO                     |
          | namesuffix        |             | NameSuffix of contact                                                                      | NO                     |
          | nickname          |             | Nickname of contact                                                                        | NO                     |
          | birthday          |             | Birthdate of contact                                                                       | NO                     |
          | source            |             | The source from where the contact originated.                                              | RO                     |
          | deletionsource    |             | Indicates the deletion source.                                                             | NO                     |
          | endpointassoc     | type        | EndpoinType of contact                                                                     | RO                     |
          | endpointassoc     | id          | EndpoinId of contact                                                                       | RO                     |
          | endpointassoc     | name        | Endpoint name of contact                                                                   | NO                     |
          | endpointassoc     | state       | Contact state to the endpoint The values might be promoted, demoted, propmote_pending etc. | NO                     |
          | buddyassoc        | buddyuserid | Buddy UserId of contact                                                                    | RO                     |
          | shareassoc        | id          | ShareId associated with contact                                                            | RO                     |
          | shareassoc        | name        | ShareName associated with contact                                                          | RO                     |
          | prefmodeofcontact | type        | The type of preferred mode of communication for the contact                                | NO                     |
          | prefmodeofcontact | value       | The preferred mode of communication for the contact                                        | NO                     |
          | conflicttype      |             | Conflict Type of contact                                                                   | RO                     |
          | incaseofemergency |             | Specifies contact as ICE or not                                                            | NO                     |
          | favorite          |             | Specifies contact as favourite                                                             | NO                     |
          | photo             | ContentType | Photo of contact                                                                           | NO                     |
          | photoreference    |             | Photo of contact                                                                           | RO                     |
          | anniversary       |             | Marriage anniversary date                                                                  | NO                     |
          | spouse            |             | Spouse of contact                                                                          | NO                     |
          | children          |             | Children Names of contact                                                                  | NO                     |
          | note              |             | Note for the contact                                                                       | NO                     |
          | orgname           |             | Company Name of contact                                                                    | NO                     |
          | orgunit           |             | Company Department of contact                                                              | NO                     |
          | jobtitle          |             | Job titile of contact                                                                      | NO                     |
          | profession        |             | Profession of contact                                                                      | NO                     |
          | assistant         |             | Assistant Name of contact                                                                  | NO                     |
          | gender            |             | Gender of the contact                                                                      | NO                     |
          | relationship      |             | Relationship of the contact with the person                                                | NO                     |
          | maritalstatus     |             | Marital status of the contact                                                              | NO                     |
          | timezone          |             | Timezone of the contact                                                                    | NO                     |
          | created           |             | Created date of contact                                                                    | NO                     |
          | modified          |             | Modified date of contact                                                                   | NO                     |
          | tel               | type        | Telephone type of contact                                                                  | YES                    |
          | tel               | indx        | Telephone indx of contact                                                                  | NO                     |
          | number            |             | Telephone Number of contact                                                                | NO                     |
          | carrier           |             | Telephone Carrier of contact                                                               | NO                     |
          | preference        |             | Telephone Preference of contact                                                            | NO                     |
          | email             | type        | Email Type of contact                                                                      | YES                    |
          | email             | indx        | Email Indx of contact                                                                      | NO                     |
          | address           |             | Email Address of contact                                                                   | NO                     |
          | preference        |             | Email Preference of contact                                                                | NO                     |
          | im                | type        | IM type of contact                                                                         | YES                    |
          | address           |             | IM address of contact                                                                      | NO                     |
          | preference        |             | IM preference of contact                                                                   | NO                     |
          | address           | type        | Address type of the contact                                                                | YES                    |
          | address           | indx        | Address indx of the contact                                                                | NO                     |
          | pobox             |             | Post box number of the address                                                             | NO                     |
          | street            |             | Street Number of the address                                                               | NO                     |
          | apartment         |             | Apartment Number of the address                                                            | NO                     |
          | city              |             | City of the address                                                                        | NO                     |
          | state             |             | State of the address                                                                       | NO                     |
          | zipcode           |             | Zipcode of the address                                                                     | NO                     |
          | country           |             | Country of the address                                                                     | NO                     |
          | preference        |             | Preference of the address                                                                  | NO                     |
          | webpage           | type        | Webpage Type of contact                                                                    | YES                    |
          | webpage           | indx        | Webpage Indx of contact                                                                    | NO                     |
          | url               |             | Webpage Url of contact                                                                     | NO                     |
          | groups            |             | Groups Type of contact                                                                     | YES                    |
          | groups            | group       | Group added to contact                                                                     | NO                     |
          | group             | id          | Group Id                                                                                   | YES                    |
          | group             | name        | Name of the group                                                                          | YES                    |
          | group             | version     | Version of the group                                                                       | YES                    |
          | group             | type        | Group Type                                                                                 | YES                    |
          | group             | itemGuid    | Group item guid                                                                            | NO                     |
          | extfield          | name        | Name of the extensible field                                                               | YES                    |
          | extfield          | value       | Value of the extensible field                                                              | YES                    |
          | DELETE            | override    | boolean value if set contact version is not considered while deleting contact              | YES.                   |
          | PROMOTE           | override    | boolean value if set contact version is not considered while promoting contact             | NO.                    |
          | DEMOTE            | override    | boolean value if set contact version is not considered while demoting contact              | NO.                    |
          | dedupe            |             | Dedupe status of the contact can be set to pending or completed                            | OPTIONAL               |
        content:
          application/xml:
            schema:
              type: object
              xml:
                name: get profile response
            examples:
              DELETE:
                description: Deletes contacts
                value: >-
                  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

            type: string

                          <ns1:contact version="1" id="7018228b0128100080f851a63affe120"/>
                        </ns1:status>
                      </ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                    </ns1:contacts-response>
                User is not authorized to access data:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
                    <ns1:contacts-response xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" userid="15782943416" xsi:schemaLocation="ContactsOperationsResponse.xsd">
                      <ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                        <ns1:status>
                          <ns1:code>4008</ns1:code>
                          <ns1:msg>User is not authorized to access data</ns1:msg>
                          <ns1:contact version="1" id="7018228b0128100080f851a63affe120"/>
                        </ns1:status>
                      </ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                    </ns1:contacts-response>
        '403':
          description: Successful response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: get profile response
              examples:
                Authorization Failed:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
                    <ns1:contacts-response xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" userid="15782943416" xsi:schemaLocation="ContactsOperationsResponse.xsd">
                      <ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                        <ns1:status>
                          <ns1:code>4004</ns1:code>
                          <ns1:msg>Authorization Failed</ns1:msg>
                          <ns1:contact version="1" id="7018228b0128100080f851a63affe120"/>
                        </ns1:status>
                      </ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                    </ns1:contacts-response>
        '422':
          description: Successful response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: get profile response
              examples:
                Xml is not valid:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
                    <ns1:contacts-response xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" userid="15782943416" xsi:schemaLocation="ContactsOperationsResponse.xsd">
                      <ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                        <ns1:status>
                          <ns1:code>4010</ns1:code>
                          <ns1:msg>Xml is not valid</ns1:msg>
                          <ns1:contact version="1" id="7018228b0128100080f851a63affe120"/>
                        </ns1:status>
                      </ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                    </ns1:contacts-response>
                Contact Owner couldn't be modified:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
                    <ns1:contacts-response xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" userid="15782943416" xsi:schemaLocation="ContactsOperationsResponse.xsd">

                        </ns1:status>
                      </ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                    </ns1:contacts-response>
                Addressbook locked as the dedupe is in progress:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>

                    </ns1:contacts-response>

        '500':
          description: Successful response
          content:

              schema:
                type: object

                  name: get profile response
              examples:
                Unknown error:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>

                Field value exceeds the maximum length:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
                    <ns1:contacts-response xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" userid="15782943416" xsi:schemaLocation="ContactsOperationsResponse.xsd">
                      <ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                        <ns1:status>
                          <ns1:code>4103</ns1:code>
                          <ns1:msg>Field value exceeds the maximum length</ns1:msg>

                        </ns1:status>
                      </ns1:DELETE-STATUS>
                    </ns1:contacts-response>
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Get Create Address book Contacts 55 pending
      description: |
        This method is used for retrieving the contacts.If the contact's phone has an associated ICS account ,this information is displayed through the "account" element.The corresponding preference to show if the account is visible or not is retrieved from "useridhidden" attribute. The response also shows the dedupe type whether pending or completed through the "dedupe" attribute.
        
        NOTE :
        1. Strings are compared case-insensitive.
        2. For parameter field-tag.type any field name excluding the index can be specified.
        3. Both the prefix and suffix wildcards are allowed as well, indicating substring
        match - e.g. *123*.
        4. Date&Time values are compared in full. That is, no substring matching for them.
        5. A Boolean existential expression is supplied by omitting the value part -
        e.g. &tel.mobile& evaluates to true of mobile phone number exists.
        6. A Boolean non-existential expression is supplied by appending a tilde (~)
        to the existential expression.
        E.g. &~tel.mobile& evaluates to true if a mobile phone number does not exist.
        7. Only one of ascending or descending sort can be requested.
        8. Range Filtering is requested through the query parameters "rangebegin"
        and "maxitems"
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: fields
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          examples:
            all:
              value: all
            firstname:
              description: Obtains the contact with fields specified.
              value: firstname #comma separated field names
          description: Obtains the contact with all fields
        - name: name
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: F1
          description: Filter the contacts by a name field
        - name: email
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: email
          description: Filter the contacts by a email field
        - name: im
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: john
          description: Filter the contacts by a Im field
        - name: address
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sunnyvale
          description: Filter the contacts by a Address field
        - name: url
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: john
          description: Filter the contacts by a Url field
        - name: tel
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: 15782943416
          description: Filter the contacts by a Tel field
        - name: address.home #field-tag.type
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: home
          description: Filter the contacts by specified field type
        - name: address.home.street  #address.type.subfield
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: washington
          description: Filter the contacts by subfield of the address fields
        - name: sort-asc
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: firstname
          description: Sort the contacts according to the field and ascending order specified
        - name: sort-desc
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: firstname
          description: Sort the contacts according to the field and descending order specified
        - name: rangebegin
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: 0  #sort-asc=lastname,firstname&rangebegin=0&maxnum=20
          description: Specifies index of the starting contact item after sorting
        - name: maxnum
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: 20
          description: Specifies maximum number of contact items to fetch after sorting
        - name: contactids
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: cd5f85270126100081df3cb040b88554,cd5f85270126100081df3sdc45b88554
          description: Specifies a list of comma seperated contact ids
        - name: ff
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: exclude
          description: Specifies whether fields should be excluded or included. Values can be exclude or include. Default is include.
        - name: size
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: 100x200
          description: Retrieves the contact's image with specified size
        - name: imagetype
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: png
          description: Retrieves the contact's image with specified type
        - name: conflicttype
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: all
          description: Retrieves the contacts with duplicates, conflicts or both.
        - name: group.id
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: groupId1
          description: Retrieves the contacts using Group Id
        - name: group.ids
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: groupId1,groupId2
          description: Specifies a list of comma seperated Group Ids
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: |
            Contact Photo Fetch Status
            
            Synchronoss service can encounter issues while fetching the photo from the Image Server. If photo fetch fails the get contact call does not fail. This is specifically done to degrade the service rather than bringing it down. Applications must use the status attribute on the photo element to handle contact photo failures accordingly. The following table describes the contact photo fetch status codes.
            | status    | DESCRIPTION                                                  |
            |-----------|--------------------------------------------------------------|
            | success   | The contact photo was successfully retrieved.                |
            | client    | The contact photo was not fetched due to connection issues.  |
            | server    | The contact photo was not fetched due to server issues.      |
            | coding    | F1 coding issue. Please contact Synchronoss if you see this. |
            | transcode | Transcoding of the photo to the specified image type failed. |
            | notfound  | The contact photo was not found in the system.               |
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: get profile response
              examples:
                Successful response:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
                    <ns1:contacts-response-get xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xsi:schemaLocation="ContactsGetResponse.xsd">
                      <ns1:f1account userid="15782943416">
                        <ns1:addrbook updated="2023-09-04T08:09:39.000Z">

                              <ns1:partial-data>false</ns1:partial-data>
                              <ns1:content-len>2</ns1:content-len>
                            </ns1:meta>
                            <ns1:contact version="4" id="6886e444018a1000804619694a8e19d6">

                              <ns1:itemguid>e991498900a827409939e0a27b31c44e</ns1:itemguid>
                            </ns1:contact>

                        </ns1:addrbook>
                      </ns1:f1account>
                    </ns1:contacts-response-get>
        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax

  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/ab/contacts/{contactId}/picture:
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Get address book contacts contactId picture 56
      description: |
        This method is used for retrieving the picture for a contact in recycle bin. It should be noted that the picture id can be obtained from the contact itself which has the picture id as a photo reference field.

        Users should specify the picture id in the URL. The browser will be able to cache the image based in this URL. Whenever the picture changes the picture id will also change. This should cause the browser to load the picture again.
        
        Fetching the Contact Picture through the picture URL $UserId/ab/contacts/$ContactId/picture is now deprecated. A Photo Reference must be used with the URL as the PictureId. The photo reference is obtained as a part of the contact.
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: contactId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            c80460b2018a1000805d6580ba7182f0
        - name: size
          description: Retrieves the picture with specified size
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: 100x200
        - name: imagetype
          description: Retrieves the picture with specified type Default is na.
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: png
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: image/gif
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
          content:
            image/png:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
              examples:
                success response:
                  description: |
                    HTTP HEADERS This call will also return in the response the following HTTP headers.

                    | HEADER        | SAMPLE VALUE                  |
                    |---------------|-------------------------------|
                    | Expires       | Tue, 19 Jan 2038 03:14:00 GMT |
                    | Cache-Control | max-age=877853160             |

          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax
        '401':
          description: Authentication Failed
        '403':
          description: Authorization Failed
        '404':
          description: Resource Not Found
        '405':
          description: Method Not Found
        '409':
          description: Resource access Conflict

          description: Bad Request Semantics

          description: Internal Server Error

      summary: Put modify address book contacts contact id picture 57 pending

              type: object

                my-attachment:
                  type: array
                  items:
                    format: binary
                    type: string

          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416

          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            c80460b2018a1000805d6580ba7182f0

          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: image/gif

          in: header

            type: string

          in: header

            type: string

          in: header

            type: string
          example: HANDSET

          in: header

            type: string

            Basic

      tags:
        - default
      summary: Delete address book contacts contactId picture 59
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: contactId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            c80460b2018a1000805d6580ba7182f0
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax
        '401':
          description: Authentication Failed
        '403':
          description: Authorization Failed
        '404':
          description: Resource Not Found
        '405':
          description: Method Not Found
        '409':
          description: Resource access Conflict
        '422':
          description: Bad Request Semantics
        '500':
          description: Internal Server Error
  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/ab/contacts/{contactId}/picture/{pictureId}:
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Get address book contacts contactId picture 60
      description: |
        This method is used for retrieving the picture for a contact in recycle bin. It should be noted that the picture id can be obtained from the contact itself which has the picture id as a photo reference field.

        Users should specify the picture id in the URL. The browser will be able to cache the image based in this URL. Whenever the picture changes the picture id will also change. This should cause the browser to load the picture again.

        Fetching the Contact Picture through the picture URL $UserId/ab/contacts/$ContactId/picture is now deprecated. A Photo Reference must be used with the URL as the PictureId. The photo reference is obtained as a part of the contact.
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: contactId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            c80460b2018a1000805d6580ba7182f0
        - name: pictureId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            6d4c5fb2018a100092dcaa509959a2e3
        - name: size
          description: Retrieves the picture with specified size
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: 100x200
        - name: imagetype
          description: Retrieves the picture with specified type Default is na.
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: png
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: image/gif
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
          content:
            image/png:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
              examples:
                success response:
                  description: |
                    HTTP HEADERS This call will also return in the response the following HTTP headers.

        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax
        '401':
          description: Authentication Failed
        '403':
          description: Authorization Failed
        '404':
          description: Resource Not Found
        '405':
          description: Method Not Found
        '409':
          description: Resource access Conflict
        '422':
          description: Bad Request Semantics
        '500':
          description: Internal Server Error
  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/ab/import/session:

    put:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Put Create Address book import session 62 pending
      description: This method is used for starting and ending import sessions during contacts import. In start import session it checks the existence of contacts in import address book and in end import session it starts the dupe detection process. An echo is sent in the request parameter or as a cookie for insession notification and alerts. This information is sent in the DupeCompletionEvent once the dedupe process is completed.
      requestBody:
        description: |
          INPUT ELEMENTS AND ATTRIBUTES
          
          The input should have the following ELEMENTS or ATTRIBUTES specific to the operations performed
          | ELEMENTS | ATTRIBUTES | DESCRIPTION                                                                                  | REQUIRED                           |
          |----------|------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------|
          | session  |            | defines start/end import session                                                             | YES                                |
          | state    |            | contains values inservice or completed to identify whether it is start or end import session | YES. either of inservice/completed |
        content:
          application/xml:
            schema:
              type: object
              xml:
                name: Create Address book Contacts request
              example: >-

                        <f1:state>completed</f1:state>
                    </f1:session>
                </f1:import-sess-modify-req>

                            <f1:code>-1</f1:code>
                            <f1:msg>Unknown error</f1:msg>
                        </f1:status>
                    </f1:import-sess-del-resp>
                Internal Server Error:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

                        </f1:status>
                    </f1:import-sess-del-resp>
  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/ab/contacts/dedupe:
    post:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Create address book contacts dedupe 64
      description: Automatic dedupe. This method is used for posting contacts de-dupe job.
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/xml:
            schema:
              type: object
              xml:
                name: Create address book contacts dedupe request
            examples:
                dedupe request:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                    <f1:dedupe-request xmlns:f1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1 ContactInteractiveDedupeRequest.xsd ">
                      <f1:contact id="6886e444018a1000804619694a8e19d6" tempid="" version="4"/>
                    </f1:dedupe-request>
                dedupe contact list request:
                  summary: Interactive dedupe. This method is used to get the duped contacts among the Contact list.
                  description: This operation sends an xml with contact list.
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                    <f1:dedupe-request xmlns:f1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1 ContactInteractiveDedupeRequest.xsd ">
                      <f1:contact id="0e521161013c10008015069f71150ff6" tempid="" version="2"/>
                      <f1:contact id="0e521161013c10008016069f71150ff6" tempid="" version="2"/>
                      <f1:contact id="0e521161013c10008013069f71150ff6" tempid="" version="2"/>
                      <f1:contact id="d8b9f26b013c100080022b0dc722ef28" tempid="" version="2"/>
                      <f1:contact id="d8b9f26b013c100080042b0dc722ef28" tempid="" version="2"/>
                    </f1:dedupe-request>
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: echo
          description: Contains the echo data recieved from the request
          in: query
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            session tracking information from the client
        - name: dedupeAll
          description: Contains the information whether to trigger the de-dupe job for all the contacts in the userids default address book or not.
          in: query
          required: true
          schema:
            type: boolean
          example: >-
            true/false. Default false
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic

  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/profile:
    description: "Profile is an extension of the preferences API. This API allows you to specify a profile and manage it.\n\n
                  The Profile Management API exposes the following Resources:"
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Get user Profile 65
      description: This method is used for retrieving the profile for userid
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Successful response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: get profile response
              examples:
                Success response:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
                    <ns1:profile-get-response xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xsi:schemaLocation="ProfileGetResponse.xsd">
                        <ns1:f1account userid="15782943416">
                            <ns1:profile>
                                <ns1:firstname>TestFName</ns1:firstname>
                                <ns1:lastname>TestLName</ns1:lastname>
                                <ns1:source>mbpim</ns1:source>
                                <ns1:created>2023-08-30T07:03:23.000Z</ns1:created>
                                <ns1:modified>2023-08-30T10:35:22.000Z</ns1:modified>
                                <ns1:incaseofemergency>false</ns1:incaseofemergency>
                                <ns1:favorite>false</ns1:favorite>
                                <ns1:dedupe>pending</ns1:dedupe>
                            </ns1:profile>
                        </ns1:f1account>
                    </ns1:profile-get-response>
        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax
        '401':
          description: Authentication Failed
        '403':
          description: Authorization Failed

          description: Resource Not Found

          description: Method Not Found

          description: Resource access Conflict

          description: Bad Request Semantics

          description: Internal Server Error

      tags:
        - default
      summary: Put update user Profile 65
      description: This method is used for modifying the profile.
      requestBody:
        description: |
          INPUT ELEMENTS AND ATTRIBUTES
          The input should have the following ELEMENTS or ATTRIBUTES
          | ELEMENTS          | ATTRIBUTES   | DESCRIPTION                                                 | REQUIRED |
          |-------------------|--------------|-------------------------------------------------------------|----------|
          | modify            | replace      | boolean to specify the operation is modify or replace       | NO       |
          | firstname         |              | First Name of the contact                                   | NO       |
          | lastname          |              | Last Name of the contact                                    | NO       |
          | middlename        |              | Middle Name of the contact                                  | NO       |
          | nameprefix        |              | NamePrefix of contact                                       | NO       |
          | namesuffix        |              | NameSuffix of contact                                       | NO       |
          | nickname          |              | Nickname of contact                                         | NO       |
          | birthday          |              | Birthdate of contact                                        | NO       |
          | source            |              | The source from where the contact originated.               | NO       |
          | endpointassoc     | endpointtype | EndpoinType of contact                                      | NO       |
          | endpointassoc     | endpointid   | EndpointId of contact                                       | NO       |
          | buddyassoc        | buddyuserid  | Buddy UserId of contact                                     | NO       |
          | prefmodeofcontact | type         | The type of preferred mode of communication for the contact | NO       |
          | prefmodeofcontact | value        | The preferred mode of communication for the contact         | NO       |
          | conflicttype      |              | Conflict Type of contact                                    | NO       |
          | incaseofemergency |              | Specifies contact as ICE or not                             | NO       |
          | photo             | ContentType  | Photo of contact                                            | NO       |
          | anniversary       |              | Marriage anniversary date                                   | NO       |
          | spouse            |              | Spouse of contact                                           | NO       |
          | children          |              | Children Names of contact                                   | NO       |
          | note              |              | Note for the contact                                        | NO       |
          | orgname           |              | Company Name of contact                                     | NO       |
          | orgunit           |              | Company Department of contact                               | NO       |
          | jobtitle          |              | Job titile of contact                                       | NO       |
          | profession        |              | Profession of contact                                       | NO       |
          | assistant         |              | Assistant Name of contact                                   | NO       |
          | gender            |              | Gender of the contact                                       | NO       |
          | relationship      |              | Relationship of the contact with the person                 | NO       |
          | maritalstatus     |              | Marital status of the contact                               | NO       |
          | timezone          |              | Timezone of the contact                                     | NO       |
          | created           |              | Created date of contact                                     | NO       |
          | modified          |              | Modified date of contact                                    | NO       |

  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/endpoints:
    description: "User can set up multiple endpoints to sync his contact data. This API allows creation and management of all the user endpoints.\n\n
                  The Endpoints Management API exposes the following Resources:"
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Get endpoints 66
      description: |
        This method is used for retrieving endpoints information includes pc client auto sync attributes, mobile client state attributes for a user.
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: view
          description: available or user .Default value is user
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: user
        - name: attributes
          description: List endpoint attributes which are needs to be displayed for the endpoint.
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: attributeslist
        - name: supportedFields
          description: Flag to filter endpoint supported contact fields. Default value is true
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: boolean
          example: true
        - name: autopromote
          description: Flag to filter endpoint autopromote settings info . Default value is true
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: boolean
          example: true
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: |
            The following attributes are displayed in GET endpoints call.
            
            Mobile client state attributes
            | PHONE STATE                                                                            | GET ENDPOINTS RESPONSE                                                                                          |
            |----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
            | User has a phone in the normal state i.e. it has been provisioned and is ready to sync | device.status=ACTIVE device.customer.model=empty or unavailable in the response device.client.support=SUPPORTED |
            | User switches to new phone. Client is supported on the new phone.                      | No phone device will be returned.                                                                               |
            | User switches to new phone. Client is NOT supported on the new phone.                  | No phone device will be returned.                                                                               |
            
            PC Client Auto-Sync Attributes
            | ATTRIBUTE                  | DESCRIPTION                                                                                                                    | READONLY |
            |----------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------|
            | dc.auto-sync.interval      | The interval after which the PC client will try to sync                                                                        | Yes      |
            | dc.auto-sync.checkInterval | The interval at which the PC client will check for any updates to the dc.auto-sync. interval by invoking WSG GET ENDPOINT API. | Yes      |                    
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
              examples:
                success response:
                  summary: Rollback processing pending
                  value: >-

        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax
        '401':
          description: Authentication Failed
        '403':
          description: Authorization Failed
        '404':
          description: Resource Not Found

          description: Method Not Found

          description: Resource access Conflict
        '422':
          description: Bad Request Semantics
        '500':
          description: Internal Server Error
    post:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: post endpoints 67
      description: |
        This method is used for adding end points.
        
        NOTE :
        1. While adding google endpoint complete username should be specified with email address
        like username@gmail.com
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: accountInfo
          description: Account info like f1username, endpoint username , endpoint password will be displyed in add endpoint response
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: boolean
          example: true
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/xml:
            schema:
              type: object
              xml:
                name: Create Address Book Group request
            examples:
              SAMPLE REQUEST:
                description: |
                  The input should have the following ELEMENTS or ATTRIBUTES
                  | ELEMENTS               | ATTRIBUTES           | DESCRIPTION                   | REQUIRED |
                  |------------------------|----------------------|-------------------------------|----------|
                  | endpoint               | endpointtype         | type of end point             | YES      |
                  | endpoint               | endpointid           | end point id                  | YES      |
                  | name                   |                      | name of end point             | YES      |
                  | username               |                      | User Name of the end point    | YES      |
                  | password               |                      | Password of the end point     | YES      |
                  | attributes             | attribute            | supported attributes list     | OPTIONAL |
                  | attribute              | value                | attribute vale                | OPTIONAL |
                  | attribute              | name                 | attribute name                | OPTIONAL |
                  | autopromote- endpoints | autopromote-endpoint | List of autopromote-endpoints | OPTIONAL |
                  | autopromote- endpoint  | endpointid           | endpointid for auto-promote   | YES      |
                  | autopromote- endpoint  | endpointtype         | endpointtype for auto-promote | YES      |
                  | autopromote- endpoint  | autopromote          | Boolean value TRUE            | FALSE    |
                value: >-
                  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                  <!--Sample XML file generated by XMLSpy v2009 sp1 (http://www.altova.com)-->
                  <f1:end-point-add-request xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1 EndPointAddRequest.xsd" xmlns:f1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
                          <f1:endpoint endpointtype="google.portal" endpointid="google.portal^testdevwsg@gmail.com">
                                  <f1:name>GoogleDevice</f1:name>
                                  <f1:username>testdevwsg@gmail.com</f1:username>
                                  <f1:password>Test1234</f1:password>
                                  <f1:attributes>
                                  <f1:attribute name="google.device.sync" value="on"/>
                          </f1:attributes>
                                  <f1:autopromote-endpoints>
                                          <f1:autopromote-endpoint autopromote="true" endpointtype="yahoo.portal" endpointid="yahoo.portal^john@yahoo.com"/>
                                  </f1:autopromote-endpoints>
                          </f1:endpoint>
                  </f1:end-point-add-request>
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
              examples:
                success response:
                  summary: Rollback processing pending
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                    <ns1:end-point-add-response xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" userid="12222233333" xsi:schemaLocation="EndPointAddResponse.xsd">
                        <ns1:status endpointid="google.portal^testdevwsg@gmail.com" endpointtype="google.portal">
                            <ns1:code>4000</ns1:code>
                            <ns1:msg>Success</ns1:msg>
                        </ns1:status>
                    </ns1:end-point-add-response>
        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: User is in Different PU response
              examples:
                User is in Different PU:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

                        <ns1:status endpointid="google.portal^testdevwsg@gmail.com" endpointtype="google.portal">
                            <ns1:msg>User is in Different PU</ns1:msg>
                        </ns1:status>
                    </ns1:end-point-add-response>
        '400':
          description: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
          content:

              schema:
                type: object

                  name: Get snapshot response by snapshot id success response
              examples:
                Endpoint type is not matching:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                    <ns1:end-point-add-response xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" userid="12222233333" xsi:schemaLocation="EndPointAddResponse.xsd">
