  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/ab:
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Get Address Book 97
      description: This method returns the address book object for NAB for a user. By default only the basic information about an address book is returned. However, changes in the address book from a specific date can be obtained by specifying a from date in the parameter and setting the changes parameter to true.
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: from
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            2023-09-05T18:00:00.0Z
          description: Retrieves the addressbook changes from the specified date
        - name: changes
          in: query
          schema:
            type: boolean
          example: 'true'
          description: This flag allows server to include all the addressbook changes. If this flag is set shown. Changes value is false specifies that show only contactcount,recycle count,created time and modifiedDateTime.
        - name: type
          in: query
          schema:
            type: string
          examples:
            all:
              value: 'all'
            mail:
              value: 'tony@google.com'
          description: This flag allows server to retrieve all or particular addressbook changes. If this flag is set to all means it will fetch all addressbooks changes , or type=addr_name it will fetch particular addr changes , default it will fetch default addre book changes .
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            

      responses:
        '200':
          description: get address book response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: get address book response
              examples:
                success response with changes true:
                  description: Client making call to server for first time (without passing from parameter). GET http://wsghost:port/wsg/nab/v1/14087729650/ab?changes=true
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                    <ab-response-get xmlns="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1"
                                     xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
                                     xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" userid="14087729650">
                        <addrbook xmlns:f1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" f1:itemcount="2" f1: recycleitemcount="5">
                            <changes serverdatetime="2006-05-03T18:13:51.0Z">
                                <adds f1:itemcount="2">
                                    <contact version="1" id="1234GEHYDT6DF">
                                        <firstname>John</firstname>
                                        <lastname>Doe</lastname>
                                    </contact>
                                    <contact version="1" id="DF34GEHYDT6DF">
                                        <firstname>Jane</firstname>
                                        <lastname>Doe</lastname>
                                    </contact>
                                </adds>
                            </changes>
                            <created>2006-05-01T18:13:51.0Z </created>

  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/syncsessions/{syncSessionId}:
    description: |
      When the user modifies the address book he may want to trigger sync to sync data from multiple endpoints in the system. This API allows to trigger sync for one or more endpoints and allows you to monitor the sync sessions within the system.

      The Syncsession Management API exposes the following Resources:
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: get syncsessions syncSessionId not executed pending 98
      description: This method is used for retrieving syncsession for userId and SyncSessionId.
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: syncSessionId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            3cf462de01241000923d6ac731abcd77
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: syncsession get response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: syncsession get response
              examples:
                success response:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                    <ns1:syncsession-get-response xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="SyncSessionGetResponse.xsd">
                        <ns1:f1account userid="12222233333">
                            <ns1:syncsession endpointid="google.portal^sandra@gmail.com" endpointtype="google.portal" id="3cf462de01241000923d6ac731abcd77">
                                <ns1:syncstatus>
                                    <ns1:status>1</ns1:status>
                                    <ns1:message>completed</ns1:message>
                                </ns1:syncstatus>
                                <ns1:syncsessionid>1234</ns1:syncsessionid>
                            </ns1:syncsession>
                        </ns1:f1account>
                    </ns1:syncsession-get-response>
        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax
        '401':
          description: Authentication Failed
        '403':
          description: Authorization Failed
        '404':
          description: Resource Not Found
        '405':
          description: Method Not Found
        '409':
          description: Resource access Conflict
        '422':
          description: Bad Request Semantics

          description: Internal Server Error
  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/syncsessions:
    description: |
      When the user modifies the address book he may want to trigger sync to sync data from multiple endpoints in the system. This API allows to trigger sync for one or more endpoints and allows you to monitor the sync sessions within the system.
      
      The Syncsession Management API exposes the following Resources:
    get:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: get syncsessions userId not executed pending 99
      description: This method is used for retrieving sync sessions for a user. All the active sync sessions for the user will be returned. Typically the last sync session will be seen for every endpoint.
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: syncsessions get response
          content:
            application/xml:
              schema:
                type: object
                xml:
                  name: syncsessions get response
              examples:
                success response:
                  value: >-
                    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                    <ns1:syncsessions-get-response xmlns:ns1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="SyncSessionsGetResponse.xsd">
                        <ns1:f1account userid="14087399999">
                            <ns1:syncsessions>
                                <ns1:meta>
                                    <ns1:partial-data>false</ns1:partial-data>
                                    <ns1:content-len>3</ns1:content-len>
                                </ns1:meta>
                                <ns1:syncsession endpointid="google.portal^sandra@gmail.com" endpointtype="google.portal">
                                    <ns1:syncstatus>
                                        <ns1:code>0</ns1:code>
                                        <ns1:msg>pending</ns1:msg>
                                    </ns1:syncstatus>
                                    <ns1:syncsessionid>1234</ns1:syncsessionid>
                                </ns1:syncsession>
                                <ns1:syncsession endpointid="yahoo.portal^sandra@yahoo.com" endpointtype="yahoo.portal">
                                    <ns1:syncstatus>
                                        <ns1:code>0</ns1:code>
                                        <ns1:msg>pending</ns1:msg>
                                    </ns1:syncstatus>
                                    <ns1:syncsessionid>1235</ns1:syncsessionid>
                                </ns1:syncsession>
                                <ns1:syncsession endpointid="fc42538501271000808c6fba4ebc30cd" endpointtype="mbpim">
                                    <ns1:syncstatus>
                                        <ns1:code>1</ns1:code>
                                        <ns1:msg>completed</ns1:msg>
                                    </ns1:syncstatus>
                                    <ns1:syncsessionid>1236</ns1:syncsessionid>
                                </ns1:syncsession>
                            </ns1:syncsessions>
                        </ns1:f1account>
                    </ns1:syncsessions-get-response>
        '301':
          description: User is in Different PU
        '400':
          description: Bad Url Syntax
        '401':
          description: Authentication Failed
        '403':
          description: Authorization Failed
        '404':
          description: Resource Not Found
        '405':
          description: Method Not Found
        '409':
          description: Resource access Conflict
        '422':
          description: Bad Request Semantics
        '500':
          description: Internal Server Error
    post:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: post syncsessions userId not executed pending 100
      description: |
        This call allows user to add a sync for specific endpoints or all user endpoints(if syncAll attribute is 'true').
        
        If a sync session is already in progress for the specified endpoint then the same sync session will be returned. New sync session will not be created for that endpoint. Applications can check for existing sync sessions using the GET api for the Sync Sessions. When the sync is completed the one single endpoint a 'On Demand Sync Completion' notification is sent to the client. If sync is triggered for multiple or if 'syncall' is specified to trigger sync on all devices then individual 'On Demand Sync Completion' events will be generated for each endpoint. If 'syncall' is triggered and user has 5 endpoints then 5 'On Demand Sync Completion' events will be generated , here when syncAll is true 'One time sync ' endpoints will be preventing from ondemand sync. User can specify dataclasses for trigger sync.
        
        An echo is sent in the request parameter or as a cookie for insession notification and alerts. The echo is later sent to 'On Demand Sync Completion' event.
        
        HTTP HEADER COOKIES
        This cookie may be obtained from the HTTP request headers.
        | COOKIE NAME | COOKIE VALUE                                 |
        |-------------|----------------------------------------------|
        | echo        | session tracking information from the client |
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: echo
          description: Contains the echo data recieved from the request
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: session tracking information from the client
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      requestBody:
        description: |
          INPUT ELEMENTS AND ATTRIBUTES
          The input should have the following ELEMENTS or ATTRIBUTES specific to the operations performed
          | ELEMENTS                  | ATTRIBUTES   | DESCRIPTION                                                                                                      | REQUIRED |
          |---------------------------|--------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------|
          | syncsessions- add-request | syncall      | If syncall flag is true then sync session will get added to all user endpoints else only for specified endpoints | OPTIONAL |
          | syncsessions- add-request | endpoint     | list of endpoints to add sync                                                                                    | OPTIONAL |
          | endpoint                  | endpointtype | End point type                                                                                                   | YES      |
          | endpoint                  | endpointid   | End point id                                                                                                     | YES      |
          | endpoint                  | dataclass    | Data class for sync                                                                                              | OPTIONAL |
          | dataclass                 | id           | Data class name like 'CONT'                                                                                      | YES      |

          

          NOTIFICATIONS GENERATED
          | NOTIFICATION              | DESCRIPTION                           |
          |---------------------------|---------------------------------------|
          | ON DEMAND SYNC COMPLETION | Generated when the sync is completed. |
        content:
          application/xml:
            schema:
              type: object
              xml:
                name: Create Address Book Group request
            examples:
              SAMPLE REQUEST - Sync All Endpoints:
                value: >-
                  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                  <f1:syncsessions-add-request syncall="true"
                      xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1 SyncSessionsAddRequest.xsd"
                      xmlns:f1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1"
                      xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
                  </f1:syncsessions-add-request>
              SAMPLE REQUEST - Sync Specified Endpoints:
                description: |
                  | ENDPOINT TYPE   | LIST OF DATACLASSES                |
                  |-----------------|------------------------------------|
                  | mbpim           | CONT,PROFILE                       |
                  | syncml          | CONT,PROFILE                       |
                  | sun.server      | CONT,PROFILE,CALN,MMS,SMS,CALL_LOG |
                  | aol.portal      | CONT                               |
                  | google.portal   | CONT                               |
                  | yahoo.portal    | CONT                               |
                  | facebook.portal | CONT                               |
                  | windows.live    | CONT                               |
                value: >-
                  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                  <f1:syncsessions-add-request syncall="false" 
                      xmlns:f1="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1"
                      xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
                      xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.fusionone.com/xmlns/f1 SyncSessionsAddRequest.xsd">
                      <f1:endpoint endpointid="google.portal^sandra@gmail.com" endpointtype="google.portal">
                          <f1:dataclass id="CONT"/>
                      </f1:endpoint>
                      <f1:endpoint endpointid="yahoo.portal^sandra@yahoo.com" endpointtype="yahoo.portal">
                          <f1:dataclass id="CONT"/>
                      </f1:endpoint>
                  </f1:syncsessions-add-request>
      responses:
        '200':
          description: syncsessions add response

                                </ns1:syncsession>
                            </ns1:syncsessions>
                        </ns1:f1account>
                    </ns1:syncsessions-add-response>
  /wsg/public/nab/v1/{userId}/sync:
    description: "This API was meant to trigger sync for individual endpoints.\n\n
                  The Synctrigger Management API exposes the following Resources:"
    post:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: Post create sync pending not executed 101
      description: |
        This method is used for triggering a sync for the endpoint of the user.
        
        HTTP HEADER COOKIES
        This cookie may be obtained from the HTTP request headers.
        | COOKIE NAME | COOKIE VALUE                                 |
        |-------------|----------------------------------------------|
        | echo        | session tracking information from the client |
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            15782943416
        - name: echo
          description: Contains the echo data recieved from the request
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
          example: session tracking information from the client
        - name: X-F1-Client-Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            YVdOekxuQnZjblJoYkRwcFkzTmZZMnhwWlc1MFgybGs6aWNzX2NsaWVudF9wYXNzd29yZA==
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token
        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/xml
        - name: X-Client-SNCR-Platform
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: HANDSET
        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      requestBody:
        description: |
          INPUT ELEMENTS AND ATTRIBUTES
          The input should have the following ELEMENTS or ATTRIBUTES
          | ELEMENTS    | ATTRIBUTES   | DESCRIPTION                                       | REQUIRED |
          |-------------|--------------|---------------------------------------------------|----------|
          | triggersync | endpointtype | type of endpoint to be synced                     | YES      |
          | triggersync | endpointid   | id of endpoint to be synced                       | YES      |
          | triggersync | userid       | userid                                            | YES      |
          | triggersync | dataclass    | dataclasses for endpoints that needs to be synced | NO       |"
        content:
          application/xml:
            schema:
              type: object
              xml:
                name: Create Address Book Group request

                <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

  /wsg/public/nab/v1/notification/register/{userId}:
    post:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: post notification register userId not executed pending 103
      description: "Notifications are used to inform endpoints of any changes on the NAB system. Notifications include, but are not limited to, Buddy Sync operations, NAB Share feature, Address Book changes, Sync operation completion (pass or fail), Account Merge operation completion, Dedupe process completion, et al.
                   This method is used to register users from notifications for a given endpoint.\n\n

                   ADDITIONAL REQUEST HEADER:
                   X-F1-Client-Authorization=Contains decoded enpointId"
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]

  /wsg/public/nab/v1/notification/unregister/{userId}:
    post:
      tags:
        - default
      summary: post notification unregister userId not executed pending 105
      description: "Notifications are used to inform endpoints of any changes on the NAB system. Notifications include, but are not limited to, Buddy Sync operations, NAB Share feature, Address Book changes, Sync operation completion (pass or fail), Account Merge operation completion, Dedupe process completion, et al.
                    This method is used to register users from notifications for a given endpoint.\n\n

                    ADDITIONAL REQUEST HEADER:
                    X-F1-Client-Authorization=Contains decoded enpointId"
      security:
        - basicAuth: [ ]
      parameters:
        - name: userId
          in: path
          required: true

            type: string

        - name: Content-Type
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: application/json
        - name: Authorization-domain
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: sncr.token

        - name: Authorization
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
          example: >-
            Basic
            
      responses:
        '200':
          description: OK
          headers:
            Date:
              schema:
                type: string
                example: Thu, 21 Sep 2023 08:39:03 GMT
            Content-Type:
              schema:
                type: string
                example: application/json
            Content-Length:
              schema:
                type: integer
                example: '4803'
            Keep-Alive:
              schema:
                type: string
                example: timeout=60
            Connection:
              schema:
                type: string
                example: keep-alive
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
              example:
                fileName: en_hux_userflow_existinguser_without_preferences.json
                fileBytes: ""

components:
  securitySchemes:
    basicAuth:
      type: http
      scheme: basic
    tokenAuth:
      type: http
      scheme: basic
    familyCloudAuth:
      type: http
      scheme: basic
